<<<<<<< HEAD
The perfect-law of God being a sermon, and no sermon;-: preach'd,-, and yet not preach'd;-: in a-church, but not in a-church; to a people, that are not a people-. / By Richard Carpenter. Wherein also, he gives his first alarum to his brethren of the presbytery; as being his-brethren, but not his-brethren. Carpenter, Richard, d. 1670?
[4], 246, [4] p.
Printed by F.L., London : 1652.
With final errata leaf. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May. 4:". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Wherein also, he gives his first alarum to his brethren of the presbytery; as being his-brethren, but not his-brethren. Carpenter, Richard, d. 1670?
[4], 246, [4] p.
Printed by F.L., London : 1652.
